language_selector.text: Please select a language to continue
intro:
**Welcome!**

This study is part of a research project on decision making.

It takes about 12 minutes.

For participating in the study, you receive a flat fee plus bonus points based on your perfromances in different tasks. **Your bonus points determine your chances on a $50 raffle**. More bonus points = higher chance of winning.

No specific background knowledge is required. As long as you follow the instructions, your bonuses should be on the higher end.

Press **Next** to begin.
intro.2:
**Welcome!**

This study is part of a research project on decision making, conducted by researchers at the New School for Social Research.

The entire study takes about 15-18 minutes.

For participating in the study, you receive a flat fee plus bonus points based on your responses in different tasks. **Your bonus points also determine your chances on a $50 raffle**. More bonus points = higher chance of winning.

The study does not require specific background knowledge. As long as you follow the instructions, your bonuses should be on the higher end. Your participation is, of course, voluntary. Your responses will be entirely anonymous.

For any questions or comments, send them to the email address below: salam955@newschool.edu

Press **Next** to begin.
intro.ug:
**Welcome!**

This study is part of a research project on decision making.

It takes about 7 minutes.

For participating in the study, you receive a flat fee plus bonus points based on your perfromances in different tasks. **Your bonus points determine your chances on a $50 raffle**. More bonus points = higher chance of winning.

No specific background knowledge is required. As long as you follow the instructions, your bonuses should be on the higher end.

Press **Next** to begin.
intro.demographics: First we need some information about you.
income.self.q: What is **your monthly income** (estimate in US dollars)?
income.parent.q: What is your **parents' monthly income** (estimate in US dollars)?
risk.qual.q: How much financial risk you are willing to take when you make a financial investment?
risk.qual.c1: a very high return, with a very high risk of losing money
tasks.intro:
Thanks. Our main questions and tasks begin next.

Remember, the responses you give in different tasks are converted into bonus points that determine your chances in a $50 raffle. You get points based on your choices, response accuracy, and speed on the specific task.

Press next to begin the first task.
bart.intro:
Great. So in the next task, you'll see a ball in the middle of the screen that grows bigger every time you press on it.

You receive **10 bonus points** for each pump, **but only if the ball doesn't blow up**. If the ball explodes, you lose all your points in that round.

You can also select the ‘**CASH**’ button to save your bonus points if you don’t want to pump the ball anymore.

Press **Next** to begin.
bart.trial_score_report: You scored {{score}} points in this round.
food.reminder.q.instruction: Have you eaten or drank any of the following in the last 24 hours?
food.reminder.time.q: When did you have your last meal?
ownership.q.instruction: Do you own any of the following items?
ownership.time.q: When did last have phone call?
gonogo.introduction:
Great. We're almost done.

Next is Go-NoGo game. For this task, you need to use the right (→) or left (←) keys on your keyboard. You'll briefly see the shape of a blue or yellow star on the left or on the right side of the screen.

If you see a blue star, you should press the key that matches the **same** side as the star. If you see a yellow star, you should press the key that points at the **opposite** side.

You have 1 second to respond but faster and accurate responses will get you more bonus points.

Let's start round 1 with feedback.
gonogo.are_you_ready: Place your fingers on the → and ← keys. Press the space bar to begin.
gonogo.too_many_timeouts: You waited too long! Let's start over.
gonogo.instruction: Use → and ← keys. Same side for blue star, opposite side for yellow star. Be quick!
gonogo.main.introduction: Ok, so let's begin round 2. You will not receive feedback. Press next to begin.
stroop.are_you_ready: Place your fingers on the → and ← keys. Press the space bar to begin.
stroop_demo.rule: Quick, what's the color of this text? Use → and ← keys.
stroop.practice.introduction:
In the next task, you'll see color names written in different inks on top.

You have two choices on the bottom. Using the right (→) or left (←) keys on your keyboard, you should select the **word** that matches the **color** of the text on top. So, - For *GREEN* or *RED*, you can choose *RED* or *RED*. - For *RED* or *GREEN*, you can choose *GREEN* or *GREEN*. Again, accurate and quick responses get more bonus points. Press next to begin the first round (you'll get feedback about your responses).
stroop.main.introduction: Now the second round begins. You will not receive feedback this time. Press next to continue.
trust.q: How much you agree or disagree with the following statements:
trust.q3: Most people are basically good and kind.
trust.q5: Most people will respond in kind when they are trusted by others.
control.q: How much you agree or disagree with the following statements:
control.q1: I can do just about anything I really set my mind to.
control.q2: When I really want to do something, I usually find a way to succeed at it.
control.q3: Whether or not I am able to get what I want is in my own hands.
control.q4: What happens to me in the future mostly depends on me.
control.q5: Other people determine most of what I can and cannot do.
control.q6: There is little I can do to change many of the important things in my life.
control.q7: I often feel helpless in dealing with the problems of life.
control.q8: What happens in my life is often beyond my control.
control.q9: There are many things that interfere with what I want to do.
control.q10: I have little control over the things that happen to me.
control.q11: There is really no way I can solve all the problems I have.
control.q12: I sometimes feel I am being pushed around in my life.
patience.q: How willing are you to give up something that is beneficial for you today in order to benefit more from that in the future?
risk.falk.q1: Do you see yourself generally as a person who is fully prepared to take risks?
risk.falk.q2: When driving a car, are you a person who takes risks?
risk.falk.q3: In financial matters, are you a person who takes risks with money (for example, investing in speculative stocks)?
risk.falk.q4: How about in sports/leisure choices, are you a person who participates in risky sports and activities (for example skiing, skydiving, camping in the wilderness, etc.)?
risk.falk.q5: In your career and social life, are you a person who takes risks (for example, switching jobs mid-career, disagreeing with your boss, moving to a city far from your family, etc.)?
risk.falk.q6: Are you a person who takes risks with their safety and health (Walk alone at night in an unsafe part of town, not wear a seatbelt in a car or a helmet on a bike, etc.)?
hunger.q: How hungry are you right now?
religiosity.q: How religious do you consider yourself?
diet.q: Are you on a special diet?
fasting.q: Were you fasting while taking this survey?
svo.q: Please pick the option that you prefer:
svo.intro:
Great. So the next task is another point allocation task. You get to decide how to split some money between yourself and another person. This person will be randomly selected from other participants in this experiment.

**Your shares will be converted to bonus points that determine your chances in a $50 raffle**. So, every choice has value: the more points you receive, the better for you, and the more points the 'Other' receives, the better for him/her.

There are no right or wrong answers -- choose the option that you, for whatever reason, prefer most. You'll play 9 rounds. Press 'Next' to begin.
pos.reicp: When someone does me a favor I am willing to return it.
neg.recip.1: If I am treated very unjustly, I will take revenge at the first occasion, even if there is a cost to do so.
neg.recip.2: How willing are you to punish someone who treats **you** unfairly, even if there may be costs for you?
neg.recip.3: How willing are you to punish someone who treats **others** unfairly, even if there may be costs for you?
altruism: How willing are you to give to good causes without expecting anything in return?
trust.falk: I assume that people have only the best intentions.
social.dilemma.q1:
In this first task, you are grouped with **4** other participants in this study. Your group is given **500 bonus points** to share.

You each privately request some points, and will not know about other people's requests.

We will add up the requests from all of you. If the total is **less than 500 points**, then you each receive the bonus points you requested. But if the total is **more than the 500 points**, none of you gets anything.

So larger requests could get you more bonus points, but you might also end up with no points at all if everyone in your group makes large requests. So how many points do you request?
social.dilemma.q2:
Round 2: This time, you and your 4 group members are given somewhere **between 425 and 575 bonus points** to share. The exact number is unknown.

How many points do you request?

* The rules are the same: Requests will be added up. Only if the sum is not larger than the total number of available points, you each get your requested points. Otherwise none of you get anything.
social.dilemma.q3:
Round 3: This time, the total number of points available to you and your 4 group members is **between 350 and 650 points**. The exact number is unknown.

How many points do you request?

* The rules are the same: Requests will be added up. Only if the sum is not larger than the total number of available points, you each get your requested points. Otherwise none of you get anything.
social.dilemma.q4:
Round 4: The total number of points available to you and your 4 group members is somewhere **between 275 and 725 points**. The exact number is unknown.

How many points do you request?

* The rules are the same: Requests will be added up. Only if the sum is not larger than the total number of available points, you each get your requested points. Otherwise none of you get anything.
social.dilemma.q5:
Round 5: Now we know the total number of points available to you and your 4 group members is somewhere **between 200 and 800 points**. The exact number is unknown.

How many points do you request?

* The rules are the same: Requests will be added up. Only if the sum is not larger than the total number of available points, you each get your requested points. Otherwise none of you get anything.
social.dilemma.q6:
Round 5 (Last one): The total number of available points available to you and your 4 group members is **between 125 and 875 points**. The exact number is unknown.

How many points do you request?

* The rules are the same: Requests will be added up. Only if the sum is not larger than the total number of available points, you each get your requested points. Otherwise none of you get anything.
p.id.intro: Please enter your Prolifc ID here:
almost.done: Thanks. Almost there, just a couple of questions about you and we'll be done for good.
trust.fehr.1: How often do you lend personal possessions to your friends (books, your car, bicycle etc.)?
trust.fehr.2: How often do you lend money to your friends?
trust.fehr.3: How often do you leave your door unlocked?
trust.game.q:
In this task, we are giving you 1000 bonus points. They are yours to keep.

We are also giving you a choice: Give some or all of these points back, we multiply it by **3**, and give it to another participant in this study. They can then decide to return some or all of the points back to you (They know we gave you 1000 points and you decided to send some points over to them).

It's entirely up to them to return anything. But it's entirely up to you to take this chance and send some bonus points over. You can keep all the points, give some, or all. What they return will be added to the points you decided to keep.

How much would you like to send?
attention.check.1: This question is aimed to measure attentiveness. Please select I somewhat disagree for this question.
attention.check.2: This question is aimed to measure attentiveness. Please select the extreme right side of the scale for this question.
fasted.days: How many days have you fasted this Ramadan?
fasted.days.2: How many days did you fast in the past Ramadan?
fast.time: How many hours was the average day of fast where you live (this past Raamdan)?
fast.time.2: How many hours was the average day of fast where you live?
fast.plan: Do you plan to fast in the upcoming Ramadan? (2022)
ramadan.knowledge: Are you familiar with Ramadan and its constituent rituals?
flourishing.1: Overall, how satisfied are you with life as a whole these days?
flourishing.2: In general, how happy or unhappy do you usually feel?
flourishing.3: In general, how would you rate your physical health?
flourishing.4: How would you rate your overall mental health?
flourishing.5: Overall, to what extent do you feel the things you do in your life are worthwhile?
flourishing.6: I understand my purpose in life.
flourishing.7: I always act to promote good in all circumstances, even in difficult and challenging situations.
flourishing.8: I am always able to give up some happiness now for greater happiness later.
flourishing.9: I am content with my friendships and relationships.
flourishing.10: My relationships are as satisfying as I would want them to be.
flourishing.11: How often do you worry about being able to meet normal monthly living expenses?
flourishing.12: How often do you worry about safety, food, or housing?
gratitude.1: I have so much in life to be thankful for.
gratitude.2: If I had to list everything that I felt grateful for, it would be a very long list.
gratitude.3: When I look at the world, I don’t see much to be grateful for.
gratitude.4: I am grateful to a wide variety of people.
gratitude.5: As I get older I find myself more able to appreciate the people, events, and situations that have been part of my life history.
gratitude.6: Long amounts of time can go by before I feel grateful to something or someone.
t.selfcontrol.1: After doing a challenging mental activity, I need to “refuel” (e.g., by taking a break, watching TV, or eating a snack).
t.selfcontrol.2: After completing a demanding mental activity, I find that my energy is used up.
t.selfcontrol.3: When I have been working on a difficult mental activity, I feel energized and ready to tackle another challenging activity.
t.selfcontrol.4: My mental stamina fuels itself. Even after doing something difficult, I can keep going.
t.selfcontrol.5: When I have completed a strenuous mental activity, I can’t start another activity right away. I need to wait until my mental energy recovers.
t.selfcontrol.6: After a demanding mental activity, I feel energized for more challenging activities.
t.selfcontrol.7: If I have already resisted one temptation, I am more vulnerable to the next temptation that comes along.
t.selfcontrol.8: When I am faced with many temptations in a row, it gets more and more difficult to resist each temptation.
t.selfcontrol.9: If I have just resisted a temptation, I feel strong and able to refuse any new temptation.
t.selfcontrol.10: Resisting temptations activates my willpower, so then I am better able to face other temptations.
t.selfcontrol.11: The amount of self-control someone has is something basic about them, and it can’t be changed very much.
t.selfcontrol.12: Regarding self-control and willpower, you either have it or you don’t.
t.selfcontrol.13: Everyone has a certain level of willpower, and there is not much that they can do to change that.
BSCS.1: I am good at resisting temptation.
BSCS.2: I have a hard time breaking bad habits.
BSCS.4: I never allow myself to lose control.
BSCS.5: I do certain things that are bad for me, if they are fun.
BSCS.6: I refuse things that are bad for me.
BSCS.7: I wish I had more self-discipline.
BSCS.8: People would say that I have iron self-discipline.
BSCS.9: Pleasure and fun sometimes keep me from getting work done.
BSCS.11: I am able to work effectively toward long-term goals.
BSCS.12: Sometimes I can’t stop myself from doing something, even if I know it is wrong.
BSCS.13: I often act without thinking through all the alternatives.
effort.1: How difficult would you say fasting is for **you**?
effort.2: How difficult would you say fasting is for **other people**?
motives.q: How well does each statement describe you?
motive.external: I fast in Ramadan because others expect me to or because the situation demands it.
motive.introjected: I fast in Ramadan because I would feel ashamed, guilty, or anxious if I didn't.
motive.identified: I fast in Ramadan because I really believe it's important to who I am.
motive.intrinsic: I fast in Ramadan because of the benefits and enjoyment that it provides me.
motives.others.q: To what extent do you believe each statement true?
motive.others.external: People fast in Ramadan because others expect them to or because the situation demands it.
motive.others.introjected: People fast in Ramadan because they would feel ashamed, guilty, or anxious if they didn't.
motive.others.identified: People fast in Ramadan because they really believe it's important to who they are.
motive.others.intrinsic: People fast in Ramadan because of the benefits and enjoyment that it provides them.
motive.others.control: What would you say motivates people to fast in Ramadan?
cos1: It bothers me when other people neglect my needs.
cos2: When making a decision, I take other people's needs and feelings into account.
cos3: I'm not especially sensitive to other people's feelings.
cos4: I don't consider myself to be a particularly helpful person.
cos5: I believe people should go out of their way to be helpful.
cos6: I don't especially enjoy giving others aid.
cos7: I expect people I know to be responsive to my needs and feelings.
cos8: I often go out of my way to help another person.
cos9: I believe it's best not to get involved in taking care of other people's personal needs.
cos10: I'm not the sort of person who often comes to the aid of others.
cos11: When I have a need, I turn to others I know for help.
cos12: When people get emotionally upset, I tend to avoid them.
cos13: People should keep their troubles to themselves.
cos14: When I have a need that others ignore, I'm hurt.
situation.control.q: Consider how each of these aspects of your daily life change during Ramadan, where you live.
situation.q: Consider how each of these aspects of your daily life make fasting in Ramadan easier or more difficult.
situation.1: The people who I spend the most time with
situation.2: The situations/places where I spend the most time
situation.3: The media that I see/hear most often
context.fasting.control: Please specify how many Ramadan fasters you know in each group. A rough estimate is sufficient.
context.fasting: Please specify how many people fast in each group. A rough estimate is sufficient.
context.5: You distant neighbors (living on the same streets/blocks)
context.7: People of the town you live in
context.8: People of the province/region/state you live in
context.9: People of the country you live in
check.1: This is an attenton check. Please select very much.
check.2: This is an attenton check. Please select not at all like me.
check.3: This is an attenton check. Please select moderately agree
fasting.q.control: Do you ever fast for religous or health reasons?
submission.note: Thank you for your participation! Please press **Continue** to be redirected to the Prolific webpage.
submission.q_email: Thank you for your participation. You can see your performance on the next page. Please write your email in the box below if you'd like to participate in similar studies.
done: And we're done! Thanks for your participation. Please press continue on the enxt page to be redirected back to the Prolific.co webpage.
ultimatum.rule.text: Please allocate the tokens by dragging and dropping them in the boxes.
ultimatum.errors.required: You have to move all tokens from POT box to other boxes
ultimatum.trial_score_report: The other player {{decision}} the proposal. You received {{score}} points.
ultimatum.total_score_report: In total, you have {{score}} points. Press Next to conintue.
ultimatum.intro1.text:
In the next task, some tokens are placed between you and another participant in this study.

You decide how to divide them between the two of you, however you like.

The other player decides to accept or reject the offer. If they **accept** it, you both get your tokens.

If they **reject** it, neither of you get anything.

Press **Next** to start a step-by-step tutorial.
ultimatum.intro2.text: In the beginning of each round, the tokens are placed in the middle. You should distribute all of them by dragging and dropping them in one of the two other boxes.
ultimatum.intro3.text: When you drag a token, the color of target boxes changes.
ultimatum.intro4.text: And the box where you are about to drop the token turns green.
ultimatum.intro5.text: After you've allocated all the tokens, press the **Propose** button to see the other player's response.
ultimatum.intro6.text:
Remembers, if the other player **Accepts** your proposal, you both get your tokens.



If they **Rejects** your proposal, neither of you will get anything.
ultimatum.intro7.text:
The task begins now.

We previously obtained the other player's response to different possible proposals.

It's your turn to make the proposals. You will play **five** rounds. Press next when you're ready.

Remember, your total points determine your chances in the raffle.
dictator.rule.text: Please allocate **all** of the tokens however you like.
dictator.errors.required: You have to move all tokens from POT box to other boxes
dictator.total_score_report: In total, you have {{score}} points. Press Next to continue.
dictator.intro1.text:
In this task, you're given some tokens.

You have the choice to give some of them to another participant in this study, picked at random.

You can give them all of the tokens, or some, or none.

Press **Next** to see a step-by-step tutorial.
dictator.intro2.text: In the beginning of each round, the tokens are placed in the middle. You can distribute them by dragging them from the middle box and dropping them either in the bottom box (your box) or the top box (other player's box).
dictator.intro3.text: When you drag a token, the color of target boxes changes.
dictator.intro4.text: And the box where you are about to drop the token turns green.
dictator.intro5.text: After you've allocated all the tokens, press the **Collect** button to go to the next round.
dictator.intro6.text:
The task begins now.

You will complete this task **five** times (five different participants). Press next when you're ready.

Remember:

* Your total tokens determine your chances in the raffle.

* You can allocate the tokens **however you like**.

* You just have to allocate **all of them**.
taskswitch.are_you_ready: Place your fingers on the → and ← keys. Press **Start** to begin.
taskswitch.too_many_timeouts: You waited too long! Let's start over.
taskswitch.instruction: Use → and ← keys, or click on symbols. **Be quick!**
taskswitch.main.introduction: Ok, so let's begin round 2. You will not receive feedback. Press next to begin.
taskswitch.tutorial:
Use → and ← keys.
If the symbols are placed above the divider line you should focus only on shape of those Symbols, same side for the (blue/yellow) Circle, opposite side for the Star.
If the symbols are placed below the divider line you should only focus on the color, Same side for Yellow, opposite side for blue.
**Be quick!**
taskswitch.intro1.text:
The next task requires your focus and attention.
In each trial, a star will appear in one of the four boxes. The star can be yellow or blue.

Press next to see how you should respond.
taskswitch.intro2.text:
If the star appears in one of the top boxes, you should click on the BLUE stars, but click on the opposite side if it's YELLOW star (the empty box next to it). Like in the pictures below:
Click on Blue
Click on the other side for Yellow
taskswitch.intro3.text:
When stars appear on the bottom, you should click on the YELLOW stars:

And click on the opposite side when you see a BLUE star (the empty box next to it).
taskswitch.intro4.text: Try to respond as accurately and quickly as possible. Faster accurate response get you more points and increase your chance in a raffle. You can also use → and ← keys to make you choices
taskswitch.intro5.text: The first few rounds, you will recevied feedback on whether your response is correct or not. Press next whne youre ready.
